SEARCH
Package org.agh

Class Writer

java.lang.Object
org.agh.Writer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Writer extends Object implements Runnable
The class represents a writer task executed in a separated thread.

An instance of this class starts and stops a writing proccess

This Class implements Runnable interface, which allows it to be executed by a Thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • Writer

      public Writer(Library library, int sleepTime)
      Creates a new Writer instance.
      Parameters:
      library - the Library instance used for writing operations
      sleepTime - the thread sleep time in milliseconds; values greater than 3000 ms are capped at 3000 ms

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      The entry point of the thread execution.

      The thread continuously starts the writing process, sleeps for the specified time, and then stops the writing process until the thread is interrupted.

      If the thread is interrupted during sleep, the interruption flag is restored and the error is logged.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
